intro: Notocactus herteri, commonly known as the Herter’s notocactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical, ribbed stems that are typically green to blue-green in color. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, adding ornamental value. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-draining soil and full sun. Due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance, it is a popular choice for succulent enthusiasts.
